data.text: @kylamb8 This is all data derived from bogus tests and bogus diagnoses. Whoever goes down this rabbit hole is wasting his time.

@kylamb8 You can see synergy between #COVID obesity, air pollution, life expectancy less so number of old people. I Guess the combination of it all is lethal. https://t.co/XLHe0L1D1C https://t.co/xVBJW0jRF6
@cyborean @kylamb8 Not sure. California should be red then. I think the cross reference with the obesity is so far the strongest.

@kylamb8 The data absolutely needs to be normalized/adjusted for BMI. BMI is a massive driver of death risk. 
The colors would change appreciably and with the age overlay would tell a far truer picture.
@kylamb8 Also seems correlated to states with higher undocumented populations.  They would still show up in mortality figures but not wholly reflected in census.
@kylamb8 Red is where the bad batches were sent. Search om Howbadinfo...
@kylamb8 New York stands out for the horrible job killing thousands in nursing homes.
@kylamb8 Yes, higher obesity gives higher expected deaths gives higher excess deaths (Covid, etc). The correlation is strong. https://t.co/fWKIUJOg79
@kylamb8 I don't want to sound like a dick, but you mean correlation and not synergy. But yes, it is indeed interesting.

@kylamb8 Covid specific data are way too politicized and subjective to be useful except as propaganda.
https://t.co/bfiRiCiiBi
